title: [Large-Scale] Data-Driven Science Projects: Developing Statistical Analysis Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic statistical terms (mean, graphs) and experience with scientific experiments
context.additional_context: Project execution using real scientific data in BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environments

learning_goals: Students can collect and organize diverse scientific data to generate visualizations in three or more formats aligned with analytical objectives
Students can interpret data distribution characteristics from the perspectives of 'central tendency' and 'spread' and explain their scientific significance
Students recognize statistical analysis as a scientific inquiry process rather than mere computation and demonstrate the ability to apply it to project-driven questions

resources: Data Analysis Software (Google Sheets, Excel, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
